257 
258 // Method that return the mass of the body
262 inline decimal RigidBody::getMass() const {
263  return mInitMass;
264 }
265 
266 // Return the linear velocity
270 inline Vector3 RigidBody::getLinearVelocity() const {
271  return mLinearVelocity;
272 }
273 
274 // Return the angular velocity of the body
278 inline Vector3 RigidBody::getAngularVelocity() const {
279  return mAngularVelocity;
280 }
281 
282 // Get the inverse local inertia tensor of the body (in body coordinates)
283 inline const Matrix3x3& RigidBody::getInverseInertiaTensorLocal() const {
284  return mInertiaTensorLocalInverse;
285 }
286 
287 // Return the inverse of the inertia tensor in world coordinates.
293 
297 inline Matrix3x3 RigidBody::getInertiaTensorInverseWorld() const {
298 
299  // Compute and return the inertia tensor in world coordinates
300  return mInertiaTensorInverseWorld;
301 }
302 
303 // Update the world inverse inertia tensor of the body
309 inline void RigidBody::updateInertiaTensorInverseWorld() {
310  Matrix3x3 orientation = mTransform.getOrientation().getMatrix();
311  mInertiaTensorInverseWorld = orientation * mInertiaTensorLocalInverse * orientation.getTranspose();
312 }
313 
314 // Return true if the gravity needs to be applied to this rigid body
318 inline bool RigidBody::isGravityEnabled() const {
319  return mIsGravityEnabled;
320 }
321 
322 // Return a reference to the material properties of the rigid body
326 inline Material& RigidBody::getMaterial() {
327  return mMaterial;
328 }

334 inline decimal RigidBody::getLinearDamping() const {
335  return mLinearDamping;
336 }

342 inline decimal RigidBody::getAngularDamping() const {
343  return mAngularDamping;
344 }

346 // Return the first element of the linked list of joints involving this body
350 inline const JointListElement* RigidBody::getJointsList() const {
351  return mJointsList;
352 }
353 
354 // Return the first element of the linked list of joints involving this body
358 inline JointListElement* RigidBody::getJointsList() {
359  return mJointsList;
360 }
361 
362 // Set the variable to know whether or not the body is sleeping
363 inline void RigidBody::setIsSleeping(bool isSleeping) {
364 
365  if (isSleeping) {
366  mLinearVelocity.setToZero();
367  mAngularVelocity.setToZero();
368  mExternalForce.setToZero();
369  mExternalTorque.setToZero();
370  }
371 
372  Body::setIsSleeping(isSleeping);
373 }
374 
375 // Apply an external force to the body at its center of mass.
380 
383 inline void RigidBody::applyForceToCenterOfMass(const Vector3& force) {
384 
385  // If it is not a dynamic body, we do nothing
386  if (mType != BodyType::DYNAMIC) return;
387 
388  // Awake the body if it was sleeping
389  if (mIsSleeping) {
390  setIsSleeping(false);
391  }
392 
393  // Add the force
394  mExternalForce += force;
395 }
396 
397 // Apply an external force to the body at a given point (in world-space coordinates).
404 
408 inline void RigidBody::applyForce(const Vector3& force, const Vector3& point) {
409 
410  // If it is not a dynamic body, we do nothing
411  if (mType != BodyType::DYNAMIC) return;
412 
413  // Awake the body if it was sleeping
414  if (mIsSleeping) {
415  setIsSleeping(false);
416  }
417 
418  // Add the force and torque
419  mExternalForce += force;
420  mExternalTorque += (point - mCenterOfMassWorld).cross(force);
421 }
422 
423 // Apply an external torque to the body.
428 
431 inline void RigidBody::applyTorque(const Vector3& torque) {
432 
433  // If it is not a dynamic body, we do nothing
434  if (mType != BodyType::DYNAMIC) return;
435 
436  // Awake the body if it was sleeping
437  if (mIsSleeping) {
438  setIsSleeping(false);
439  }
440 
441  // Add the torque
442  mExternalTorque += torque;
443 }
444 
446 inline void RigidBody::updateTransformWithCenterOfMass() {
447 
448  // Translate the body according to the translation of the center of mass position
449  mTransform.setPosition(mCenterOfMassWorld - mTransform.getOrientation() * mCenterOfMassLocal);
450 }
451 
452 }
453 
454  #endif
